properties.Name: Sepesca
properties.Info: Established after the Calamity, Sepesca—meaning "Nature's End" to the Ki'Nau people—was established as a holy burial temple dedicated to the Wild Mother. The area was raided by goblins and the temple fell into ruin.

properties.Name: The Wuyun Gate
properties.Info: Standing roughly twenty feet tall and fifteen feet wide, the Wuyun Gate opens for travelers granted passage to enter or exit the Dwendalian Empire.

properties.Name: Herethis Mines
properties.Info: A bountiful vein of precious platinum lead to the construction of the vast Herethis Mines.

properties.Name: Deepriver Mine
properties.Info: Established around a plentiful source of iron and copper within a dry, subterranean riverbed, the Deepriver Mine is one of the Kryn Dynasty's most productive mining operations.

properties.Name: Ghor Veles
properties.Info: Meaning "Vault of Shadows," Ghor Veles hides a vast dungeon beneath its ruins.

properties.Name: Olc Skerry
properties.Info: Legends say the people of Olc Skerry were either slaughtered by outlanders or claimed by contagion. Sages suggest the inhabitants journeyed into the mainlands. Either way, explorers return from Olc Skerry with legends of pernicious phantoms.

properties.Name: Blooming Grove
properties.Info: Deep in the Savalirwood, the centuries-old Blooming Grove hosts a small temple that has held back the curse that darkens the forest.

properties.Name: Molaesmyr
properties.Info: Once a metropolis filled with erudite scholars and beautiful elven architecture, the city of Molaesmyr lies in ruin under a perpetual fog.

properties.Name: Uraliss
properties.Info: The small town of Uraliss was Uthodurn's first attempt to expand beyond its mountain halls. However, the settlement was beset by orcs and was quickly abandoned.

properties.Name: Cinderrest Sanctum
properties.Info: Hidden along the eastern slopes of Kravaraad is a cavern of onyx, where a pool of uncooling lava sits at the heart of the black stone grotto. Black iron adornments and supports honor the legend of Melora granting stone and ore to Moradin the All-Hammer.

properties.Name: Kravaraad
properties.Info: The volcano of Kravaraad looms in defiance against the frost and cold of the Greying Wildlands.

properties.Name: Mutalos
properties.Info: At the dawn of every day, the enivonment of Mutalos suddently changes, shifting from desert to forest to mountainous to swamp without any discernible pattern. The region is avoided by the local wildfolk at all costs.

properties.Name: Fortress of the Dead Jarl
properties.Info: From the outside, the Fortress of the Dead Jarl is an enormous fairy-tale castle made of ice. Inside the castle holds horrors of an entirely different story...

properties.Name: Aeor Crash Site
properties.Info: While pieces of Aeor were thrown all over Eiselcross, the city's main crash initially created a three-mile-diameter crater in the center of Foren.

properties.Name: Shattengrod
properties.Info: The giant sinkhole that once was Shattengrod has been excavated heavily, leaving the pit as a spiraling subterranean city with broken relics and forgotten secrets.

properties.Name: The Pallid Grove
properties.Info: Once a beautiful, untouched woodland, the Pallid Grove was home to reclusive elves and protected by illusory magic. During the Calamity, the forest was drained of life and transformed into the spectral valley it is today.

properties.Name: Draconia
properties.Info: The once-proud nation of Draconia lies in ruins at the bottom of the Dreemoth Ravine. Originally the home of dragonborn society in Wildemount, Draconia was attacked by the Chroma Conclave, sundering the floating islands and killing many inhabitants.

properties.Name: The Miskath Pit
properties.Info: An arcane sinkhole of unknown depth and origin, the Miskath Pit is filled with psychedlic sights and sounds that madden and derange the few surviving explorers.

properties.Name: Incanter's Rest
properties.Info: The Calamity-era battlefield of Incanter's Rest is now a massive graveyard haunted by the undead spirts of unnameable horrors. There are few landmarks apart from the gigantic skeletal remains of three monstrous titans.

properties.Name: Dumaran
properties.Info: The fortress of Dumaran is home to hobgoblin survivors of the Calamity. Empowered by the Spider Queen that lured them to Dumaran, the hobgoblins plan to seek punishment for the Kryn for their insolence.

properties.Name: Mythburrow
properties.Info: Locals tell stories of a monstrous, ancient being that lives in the Mythburrow. Tales of a bellowing roar that shakes the valley and sightings of an immense white-scaled dragon have been told for centuries.

properties.Name: Vergesson Sanatorium
properties.Info: Once a vast prison known as the Archevault, the Vergesson Sanitorium is run by the crown and treats patients of physical and mental ailments. However, the pleasant mansions hides much darker secrets.

properties.Name: Rastum Den
properties.Info: The moderately sized encampment of Rastum Den is nestled in a small valley elevated in the mountains. The area's dizzying heights and tumultuous weather make it all but inaccessible to those without a griffon rider's prowess.

properties.Name: Diver's Grave
properties.Info: Deep beneath the waves of the open Lucidian Ocean lies a terrifying graveyard of wrecked ships across the ocean floor. Each salvage ship that tries to reclaim cargo from the Diver's Grave only adds another corpse to its hungry sands.
